subject: Politics
title: Constitutions Explained
description: A short lesson to help you apply Constitutions Explained.

hook.text: Britain has no single written constitution. It runs on tradition. Most countries write theirs down.

buildup.text: A constitution defines how government works, who holds power, and what limits that power.

discovery.text: The US Constitution of 1787 is the world's oldest written constitution still in active use.

twist.text: Over 90% of constitutions promise free speech. Few actually deliver on that promise.

climax.text: A constitution is only as strong as the courts that enforce it and the people who defend it.

punchline.text: Constitutions are promises. Enforcement decides if they're kept.

quiz.question: What is the world's oldest active written constitution?
